Because the Behrend family is associated with the Hammermill Paper Company, it makes sense that at least one image would be printed from there.
A lot of Mary's calendar illustrations appear to be made with watercolor, usually in conjunction with pencils.

figure.figDesc: An infant is seen from behind. looking closely, the drawing was made with a different type of paper. It was likely printed, cut out, and glued onto the page.
figure.ab: That little spot in the back of his neck is the sweetest spot to kiss I know so I kiss him there and hold him close just because I love him so.
figure.note: It's clear that Mary is talking about her son Warren here. From the way she talks about him, he is a few months old (or less) and she absolutely adores him. If Warren is her first born child, then her joy from being around him makes a lot more sense.
